meanings.sent1: Tommy is such a lunks when he tries to juggle.
meanings.sent2: The new student in class is often teased for being a lunks.
meanings.sent3: The lunks in the movie always makes everyone laugh with his silly antics.
meanings.sent4: His loud laugh echoed through the room like a lunks.
meanings.sent5: The lunks tripped over his own feet, causing everyone to chuckle.

meanings.definition: To move in a slow, heavy, or awkward way.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog lunks along the path during our walks.
meanings.sent2: She lunks around the house when she's feeling lazy.
meanings.sent3: The robot lunks across the room, pretending to be a slow-motion character.
meanings.sent4: The old car lunks down the road, struggling to keep up with traffic.
meanings.sent5: The bear lunks through the forest, searching for food.

meanings.sent1: The lunks of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The distant lunks of thunder signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The lunks of the falling tree branch startled the birds in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The deep lunks of the bass drum set the rhythm for the band.
meanings.sent5: The lunks of the heavy book hitting the floor made everyone turn around.
